Juventus-Inter, Stramaccioni: "Our first win at the Juventus Stadium is still memorable. I chose Icardi as Milito's heir"

Former Inter coach Andrea Stramaccioni remembers his Nerazzurri's days in an interview with Corriere dello Sport: "That 3-1 win at the Juventus Stadium is still one of the most memorable wins in Inter history. They were stronger than us and they had never lost in that stadium. Also some decisions from the refrees were against us, but we got back from 1-0 to 3-1", says the coach currently at Sparta Prague. "When I was with Inter, I with Moratti, Branca and Ausilio, chose Icardi to be Milito's heir. When we played against Sampdoria at Marassi I said to him: "This is a beautiful stadium, but in a few months you'll have to score at San Siro". Now he is a goal machine".

After the tough 0-0 draw against Juventus in the Serie A, away at Allianz Stadium, Inter goalkeeper Samir Handanovic gave his opinions on tonight’s game to Premium Sport:
Handanovic was asked about the reason Inter don’t concede so much stating that “the team defends as a team, all together. We work a lot with fine tuning our defense. That is thanks to Spalletti and his staff. In Italy, whoever has the best defense wins the title and this is an important thing. We always have to go for the win, sometimes it is not that easy but I think that tonight we could have done better.”

The former Udinese and Slovenian international then continued: “this year I play the ball a lot more with my feet, this is what Spalletti wanted from me. Then of course, it is a lot more easier when you have players that actually want the ball and show that to me. Not every coach has actually wanted me to play more balls with my feet, for me it is a thing that improves when you practice it. Spalletti is a hammer during practices and has taught us to see a training session as a real game. We have grown a lot but we still have to grow, we still have not reache our maximum.”

In conclusion Handanovic was asked about which goalkeepers in the Serie A he thinks are better than him replying: “I only look at me and my performance, I am more worried about me than the other goalkeepers.”

Inter have a very serious interest in Nicolo Barella but completing a move for the midfielder in January will be difficult if not impossible according to a report from Sky Sport.

The young central midfielder is viewed as the ideal reinforcement for the midfield and has mesmerised many at Inter with his performances for Cagliari this season.

The Rossoblu management are unwilling to let their top prospect depart in the upcoming January transfer window but could very much be powerless come June. Cagliari want no less than €30 million for the Italian youth international but Inter are not willing to offer more than €18 million upfront and bonuses.

Barella has starred for Diego Lopez’s side making 16 appearances in Serie A scoring two goals in the process. He has been near ever present since Cagliari’s promotion to the top flight two seasons ago and is nearing 50 Serie A appearances in the Rossoblu shirt.

Pastore agent: ‘Nothing with Inter’

Javier Pastore’s agent insists there’s “really nothing” with Inter, but won’t commit his client’s future to Paris Saint-Germain.

The French club’s sporting director said today he couldn’t guarantee Pastore and his teammate Angel Di Maria would stay at the Parc des Princes.

The Nerazzurri have been heavily linked with Pastore, and his agent won’t guarantee he’ll stay with PSG, while insisting there have been no talks so far.

“There’s nothing with Inter for the moment,” Marcelo Simonian insisted, speaking to Foot Mercato.

“Really, nothing!”

The website does note, however, that Simonian wouldn’t answer when asked if Pastore would stay at PSG.

“No-one’s asked me to leave, Joao Mario’s never said anything to me, and if I can, I’ll answer him.

“He’s a good player for Inter and he can give us the solutions to win. I prefer to be told that he’d like to win more.

“Appearances aren’t ranked. Why should players ask to leave if we’re a top team? I hear little about this issue at Juventus.

“We must be organised when thinking about this issue. For example: Skriniar faces every problem like his life depends on it.

“Every ball counts, not just the ones that give a personal advantage. We’re Inter and we have ambition.

“Assessments must be made based in the context in which you find yourself. The club want to be as clear as possible.

“There are times to say certain things and the necessary plan will be prepared. We want to involve the fans in these choices.

“We must all be part of our problems and solutions. We’re all together and we also take on our fair share of problems.

“We must know how to live together. I know that a club can have ambitions and limits, and from time to time we examine what’s going on.

“We won’t have a big budget, we’ll have to be wary of doing our best. This profession is about getting the best out of yourself, aware that you have the strength to do so.”

The centre-half recently dismissed reports of interest from Barcelona, but now City boss Pep Guardiola is weighing up a deal for Skriniar to boost his defensive options.

PSG, Pastore: "If I decided to leave PSG, I would like to get back in Italy and Inter could be a side I'd like"

After a lot of contacts and indiscretions about a potential move, there finally is a concrete detail in the story between Javier Pastore and Inter whose source couldn't be more direct. The Argentinean playmaker has given an interview to the Argentinean newspaper Mundo D, and has said how there have always been real moves from the Nerazzurri towards him and told about his relationship with Sabatini: "My agent has had contacts with Inter but we're still talking about initial proposals, there's no agreement yet. If I decided to leave PSG, I would like to get back in Italy and Inter could be a side I'd like. I have a sincere friendship with Sabatini and we hear each other often, he was the one to bring me in Italy".
Fabrizio Romano(sky sport) says that Inter Milan are unlikely to agree a contract renewal with nerazzurri superstar Mauro Icardi in the coming days

Luciano Spalletti lost his temper after Inter’s 1-1 draw with Fiorentina. “Even my 80-year-old mother knows we are missing a centre-back.”

Mauro Icardi had opened the scoring somewhat against the run of play and they relied on Samir Handanovic heroics, but Giovanni Simeone snatched a stoppage-time equaliser for the Viola.

This extended the negative streak to three draws and two defeats in Serie A, not to mention crashing out of the Coppa Italia Quarter-Finals to Milan.

“There were several situations that went against us this week, as Yuto Nagatomo had flu and Andrea Ranocchia played through pain in his ribs, giving his best in the circumstances,” the Coach told Mediaset Premium.

“The team loses the ball too cheaply and that creates difficulties. We then lacked a bit of spirit, of strength in the duels. These are not our characteristics and we lost the ball in banal fashion.

“Yet we had taken the lead and, although Fiorentina deserved the equaliser, we had the chances to make it 2-0. They were off balance and we didn’t take advantage.”

Spalletti had to move Davide Santon to centre-back when Ranocchia eventually limped off, but was visibly frustrated and even angry when asked if Inter were short in some areas.

“I can’t take it anymore, I don’t know what else to say… Why don’t you go to the locker room and tell them if they aren’t good enough? I do my work, there are difficulties, it’s obvious to everybody that we are missing a centre-back. Do you want a reward for being able to count the number of players in the squad? Even my 80-year-old mother at home knows we are missing a centre-back.

“You’ve asked me the same thing since the start of the season, I’ve told you the same answer 750 times, but you keep asking. We have to work and win, not lose credibility and cry at the lack of a player.

“We have to make do with what we have and in my view we put in a good performance at times. I won't use this as an excuse, because I have to do my work and win pushing through these situations.

"We struggled to keep the ball and we didn’t keep the right distances. We ended up bunched together.”

replies.msg: Inter’s directors are determined to bring reinforcements to manager Luciano Spalletti’s squad during the January window. The nerazzurri are making progress on acquiring Ramires who currently plays for Jiangsu, a club also owned by the Suning group, earlier today the former Chelsea midfielder stated he’s open to the move which would be completed as a loan deal.

Milan Skriniar dismisses talk he could leave Inter in the near future - “I’ll keep playing for this team for as long as possible”.

The Slovakian centre-back joined the Nerazzurri from Sampdoria in the summer, and his performances have been so impressive that he’s already been linked with the likes of Barcelona.

“Will I leave Inter?” Skriniar considered, speaking to MY magazine in his homeland.

“I don’t think so, I’m happy where I am and I think I’ll keep playing for this team for as long as possible.

“My goal for 2018 is to continue with these performances, to play as many games as possible and to continue to help the team”

“I'm happy, I hope to be able to keep putting in these performances. I also hope that Inter can start well [after the winter break], because lately we haven’t been winning, but I think we'll be fine.

“We stopped scoring, we stopped playing well, and we got into a bit of ‘crisis’, but I think we can get out of it soon and that we’ll start winning again when the season restarts.

“I'll stay in Slovakia until Saturday for the break, spending time with my family and friends.

“I’ll relax and do the individual work program, then I’ll dedicate myself to my family.”

There's an update on the Rafinha situation for Inter. Barcelona has in fact given the Italian club permission to discuss personal terms with the Brazilian midfielder and yesterday Inter have made an offer that is being evaluated by the players' agents, Alex Boesch and Rafinha's father Mazinho. Rafinha is still in Barcelona with the intemediary Nicola Innocentin, but there are good chances that an agreement with the player will be reached. Today Inter will also make an official offer to the Catalan club for a loan with an option to buy. Barcelona has reassured Inter about the player's condition, who has not played in 8 months, but Inter want to be sure before deciding to sign him.

The negotiation to bring Rafinha to Inter continues. Today the player’s representatives met with Barcelona, they agreed to reconvene in the next few days after they identify a financial figure that both clubs would agree to, at the moment the blaugrana believe his value would considerably exceed 20 million after he returns to the pitch. The next few days will be important to identify the terms and formula of the potential deal, in the meantime the player has already agreed to terms with Inter. Barcelona are open to a free loan, but currently the sticking point is the amount of the option to buy since they believe 20 million plus 3 million in bonuses is too low.

replies.msg: Inter's former goalkeeper Julio Cesar was the subject of a long interview in la Gazzetta dello Sport. He was asked about several of Inter's transfer targets with whom the Brazilian is familiar. Here is an excerpt from the interview: "Ramires? In the national team he would run more than anybody, 11 or 12 km per match. He's like an animal. Now thankfully he runs less, but with the experience he's gained he does it smarter. Maybe he left too soon for China, he can definitely help Inter. Lisandro Lopez? he is a great guy, he loves to laugh and gets along with everybody. After every goal he scored he would come and give me a hug, we were great friends. Rafinha? We never played together, but he has the touch of a Brazilian, he can bring a bit of magic to the midfield. My future? I haven't yet retired, there are some things in motion. I have given myself a deadline for the end of January."

Inter Milan are in talks with Atletico Madrid over the potential signing of Nicolas Gaitan, according to Calciomercato.

The Argentine playmaker wants to leave La Liga and join Luciano Spalletti revolution at the San Siro. He's prepared to say his goodbyes this week.

replies.msg: After making the Lisandro Lopez deal official, Inter are focused on bolstering Spalletti’s midfield. The nerazzurri’s sporting director Piero Ausilio is on his way to Barcelona to continue the negotiation for Rafinha in person. While the blaugrana are asking to increase the option to buy in the deal from the current offer of €20 million plus €3 million in bonuses, Rafinha’s representatives (Alex Boesch and his father Mazinho) have reiterated that Inter is a destination the player appreciates very much also because he has already agreed to terms with the Italian club. Inter are expected to raise their offer, and there’s optimism the deal could be reached today which is the reason Ausilio is traveling to Spain to negotiate in person

Inter are increasingly confident on securing Barcelona midfielder Rafinha. Inter sporting director Piero Ausilio met with the Catalan club to continue negotiations and reach final agreement. Clubs have agreed the formula of the possible transfer, that is a loan with an option to buy, but negotiations are still ongoing to find an agreement on the buyout fee. Inter's first offer of €25 million was turned down by Barcelona, as Spanish club ask for €30 million more. It is understood that an agreement could be reached at halfway, for a sum in the region of €30 million plus bonuses.

Inter are looking at La Liga also for the attack, as they have shown interest in Atletico Madrid's winger Nico Gaitan. Should the Argentinian, born in 1988, get an EU passport, Inter could take into consideration a deal that may include Joao Mario.

According to the BBC, the Beneamata have made a “significant but undisclosed” loan offer, which would also see them take on the 28-year-old’s wages.

There have also been talks over a permanent transfer, the British state broadcaster reports.

As with the Rafinha deal, it’s likely that would have to be an option to buy rather than an obligation, as Inter are being very careful not to fall foul of FFP.

The Reds are said to be happy for Sturridge to stay, but the player himself may want more playing time with the World Cup to come in the summer.

It seems a move that could send Joao Mario from Inter to West Ham is back on. There was a brief stall, however, the English club has now decided to pay the Portuguese player's full wages, 2.5 million gross plus 400,000 in commission to his agent, for around a total of 3 million. Their president, Sullivan, does not want to pay Inter 1.5 million euro for the loan due to the fact that they are willing to pay his full wages, therefore, the preferred method of a deal for West Ham is a free loan with a option to purchase set at 30 million. Evaluations are still being done, as Inter want a paid loan. Discussions and negotiations will continue...

replies.msg:
Inter is continuing to work on the transfer market as they try to improve Luciano Spalletti's roster for the second half of the season. One of their focuses has been Javier Pastore of PSG, who would like to return to Italy. At the moment, however, the French club only wants to sell the player permanently and not loan him. It is uncertain whether the nerazzurri would entertain the option of a loan with an obligation to purchase. Then there is also the agreement that needs to be reached with the player, who currently earns 6.5 million per season plus bonuses. The negotiations are on stand-by but the teams are still in contact with each other.

PSG has also received offers between 25-40 million from Liverpool and Tottenham, but the player has rejected those destinations. Pastore's agent is currently in Milan to see if he can unlock a transfer.
